Posts.Content: kathy44 wrote: Hi I just turned 35 in October and had my first mammogram last Wednesday. I was called back to do more scans on Thursday. The x-ray tech showed me my pictures and said that what is on the right breast should be on the left. So I have a big white spot on my left breast and not on the right. There were some other white areas that were on both breast. She said the area on the left hasn't calcified yet and the doctor suggests that I come back in 6 months to see if anything changes. I have read a few things on mammograms and the different findings, but I haven't read anything about how both breast should be exactly that same. When she showed me the x-ray I kind of freaked out because there is this huge white spot that takes up a lot of my left breast. I'm waiting to hear back from my doctor. Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First mammogram came back with something kathy44 kathy44

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2013 03:14PM kathy44 wrote: Thanks for the reply. Do you know anything about how she said both breast should be exactly the same? I can't find that anywhere....on the internet of course. ;)
